page.title: 06CUSTOMS:LOCAL TYPES
page.content: Wath has an annual{Folk Festival}on the Saturday before May Day.Teams of morris dancers and Maypole dancers from Wath National,Wath Victora,St. Marys and Brampton Ellis Junior schools perform in the town centre{ {Brampton Ellis Junior school}Log Book of 1890 records that children danced round the Maypole"In front of a great concourse of people."The school has two unique customs: 1. The{Pancake Bell}is said to have been rung on shrove Tuesday at 11.00 a.m. by each pupil in turn to warn their mothers to start making pancakes. 2. The{school Dance}is also performed at this time and is said to date back to napoleonic times when French prisoners of war were to be seen working in Wath Wood.(see Custom 2)
